Ask HN: How do you send your cold sales emails?
text:
Let's face it, cold sales emails work. I'm currently using mailwizz + powersmtp, warming up with warmupinbox.com and cleaning lists.

The results leave alot to desire. In the past I've used gmail + woodpecker but it doesn't seem to scale well although it gets good open rates.

What scalable methods do you use for sales? (b2b)

Software Engineer's life became weird after providing feedback at DoorDash
text:
Leading up to the past two weeks

I worked at DoorDash as a Software Engineer for over 9 months during the pandemic. When it came time to my first performance review in early 2021, spanning an 8 month period, weird things started happening after I left constructive feedback for my coworker. My last day at DoorDash was in March 2021.

Furthermore, even a long time after I no longer worked there, my Mountain View and San Francisco residences have been harassed by "door" related incidents.

Between December 2021 and until March 2022, when I started my next job, folks were unlocking the car doors about five times, opening the storage doors about five times, stealing a license plate, drawing green paint on the side of a car, and putting a 5 inch screw into my tire.

In early December 2021, I visited and enjoyed a BTS concert, including front row. It was an amazing experience and I was clearly very happy dancing along with some of the members. When I flew back, the entry doors in both San Francisco and Mountain View residences both scraped loudly when opened.

Quickly summarizing my DoorDash experience in a factual way

1) I felt I had completed, proposed, and led many projects across both Consumer and Merchant codebases when I worked there between May 2020 through March 2021. My salary level was 5 (lowest senior), and I was working on projects with my manager to attain level 6.

2) But I was given a PIP, and then during the first meeting where I was told I did well, I was given my 2021 performance review in the last few minutes.

3) The performance review from my manager did not cover the 8-month timespan nor the major contributions since I joined. It covered one small project my manager asked me to work on end of 2020.

I decided not to pursue arbitration back in March 2021 because of the following weird events during my performance review:

1) The week prior to my last day, someone left a roll of bills at my garage door.

2) The day I got let go, a pink sticky note was put in front of the garage door.

3) There was a small dead bird on the roof, and a large crow kept flying around.

But then, harassment started again in December 2021 and escalated this summer, on July 2022, even as I got a new job in March 2022. Therefore, it made sense to contact DoorDash to get closure on what happened. Maybe there was a severance offer or similar that didn't reach me back then, so it was worth taking a few minutes to write an email.

These events were as follows:

1) In July 2022, cars on different occasions started revving engines loudly for 30 seconds when I arrived or left the Mountain View residence.

2) Someone drew an X with chalk in front of the Mountain View residence door.

In this email to DoorDash, I didn't mention any harassment. I just wanted to get closure and learn why I was let go during the PIP, and asked if the severance option they quoted verbally (6 weeks) still applied.

I also pointed out that:

1) After my last day, DoorDash switched everyone to quarterly vesting. That means my 9 months of service, with just regular performance, was worth $500k at the then-stock price because my experience had covered May '20, Aug '20, Nov '20, and Feb '21.

(Math: $430k 4-year stock grant, divide by 4, multiply by 3/4, then multiply by 5-6x post-IPO, is about $500k, or $2 million after 4 years. No base salary or bonus).

2) In 2022, DoorDash re-adjusted stock options upwards for other engineers since my employment, after the stock dropped. I was just asking for the partial value, not more value.

Ask HN: Is there a market for a better Google Analytics client?
text: I use Google Analytics, mostly to see the number of users per day, which is good. I feel it's difficult to use for exploring other views, thought about a new client with a list of cards (templates), is there an existing GA client like this? is there a market for this type of client if building one?
